title: Nonequilibrium Thermodynamics of a Superconducting Szilard Engine
authors: Kuen Wai Tang and Kyle J. Ray and James P. Crutchfield
abstract:
We implement a Szilard engine using a 2-bit logical unit consisting of
inductively coupled quantum flux parametrons (QFPs) -- Josephson-junction
superconducting circuits with applications in both the classical and quantum
information processing regimes. Detailed simulations show that it is highly
thermodynamically efficient while functioning as a Maxwell demon -- converting
heat to work. The physically-calibrated design is targeted to direct
experimental exploration. However, variations in Josephson junction fabrication
introduce asymmetries that result in energy inefficiency and low operational
fidelity. We provide a design solution that mitigates these practical
challenges. The resulting platform is ideally suited to probe the thermodynamic
foundations of information processing devices far from equilibrium.
